abstract: Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art is set to present Rachel Mason film The Lives of Hamilton Fish, which traces history of serial killer and Westchester politician with same name who died a day apart in 1936 (Metropolitan/Westchester).
lead_paragraph: A film being shown soon in Albany and Carmel traces the history of a serial killer and a Westchester politician who died a day apart in 1936.
snippet: A film being shown soon in Albany and Carmel traces the history of a serial killer and a Westchester politician who died a day apart in 1936.

keywords.value: Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Both Were Born Hamilton Fish, but Their Paths Differed
headline.seo: The Film ‘The Lives of Hamilton Fish’ Is About a Politician and a Criminal
